description: Positive integers n with exactly 2 aliquot sequence predecessors. In other words, there are exactly two solutions x for which s(x)=n. The function s(x) here refers to the Restricted Divisor Function, the sum of all proper divisors of x.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Restricted Divisor Function
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Aliquot sequence.
example: 14 is a member of the sequence because s(22)=14 and s(169)=14 (and because no other integer x satisfies s(x)=14).
mathematica: len = max = 57; f[_List] := (s = Select[ Split[ Sort[ Table[ DivisorSigma[1, n] - n, {n, 1, max *= 2}]]], Length[#] == 2 & ][[All, 1]]; s [[1 ;; Min[len, Length[s]]]]); FixedPoint[f, {}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 07 2011 *)
author: _Jack Brennen_, Oct 24 2000
